X7pu1uR9soXlhwquA3dK5Q.text: The food is SUPERB!! I had the Golden Prawns & they were seasonred to perfection.  They were so good my 6 yr old tried it & ate most of them. He hardly eats anything, but he loves the prawns. Can't wait to get the lobster next!.

xZlzb80tCnFPSpNGFj6rJQ.text: Stopped in last night for a to-go order on my first visit to this restaurant and was pleasantly surprised with the high quality of the food.  , I had fried rice with mushroom soup and spring rolls. The spring rolls it did seem a bit greasy  but they were delicious. I would certainly recommend you give this place a try if you're seeking authentic Chinese food.  The food is certainly reasonably priced. And myself being a bit temporarily handicapped the staff help carry my meal out to the car for me what wonderful people.

F35jDQx8jvlasgcvGcmmcQ.text: Lam's kitchen has really great, authentic Chinese food - the best I've had since I moved to Charlotte.  I started with a wonton soup. The wontons had both pork and shrimp and were delicious.  Then I had the steak chinese style, salt and pepper squid and pork chops. Everything was great and I can't wait to come back and try some other dishes!

2VQ4PEhsuIjogUdWA-C6yg.text: Delicious food, and very nice people.  It's small, but they have some tables outside as well.  It's a great menu with some choices you don't find at most Chinese restaurants.

oZsinU1lEz9O5Ymumy5noA.text: Ordered takeout and was pleasantly surprised!  We kept it simple as we had not ordered from here before.    The Spring Rolls were very fresh and tasty.  The sesame chicken was quality chicken breast, my son said its the best he's had here, and not so greasy.  The Singapore noodles also very fresh, tasty and not greasy. We will return and order more variety now that we've had a very good first experience.

eQgTmaf67QPmhOFkJV7uCw.text: The best Chinese food I've had in North Carolina. This is a small but incredibly popular restaurant and for god reason, the food is delicious. Expect to have to wait for a table and expect to have the food take awhile but in the end, it will be worth it. The only negative is, they don't serve beer or wine but, there's a grocery store literally right next to the place where you can purchase your favorite beer/wine and bring it next door to drink while you feast.

Qb34tBIU-nKRaLQQoycfig.text: Amazing Szechuan cuisine! All the dishes we had were so flavorful and delicious. The service for a small restaurant was very good. Don't ask for Duck sauce and Mustard because they don't have it.  This is traditional Chinese cuisine.

fDkEkj73IbIBkZaUZHuN_w.text: I'm come from Hong Kong. Lam's Kitchen is really good, I like all the dish . They are transitional Chinese favor. Many choices from menu. The price are reasonable too! High recommend! Best in town!

KJCg4enoHjnUdIsR-hmRmg.text: Authentic and reasonably priced! Serendipitously found this place for lunch one weekend and it did not disappoint. You can ask for a daily specials menu (available in Chinese only).

W6fCkfqQY2-1rZe8-2DCrw.text: Best authentic chinese food in Charlotte! The chef is very nice, I have tried several dishes and they was just perfect. My friends also enjoyed their food, they provided cantonese flavor and szechuan flavor, so you could enjoy different food in here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Authentic Cantonese flavor

yZv6fCqXar4pAvKC-OtU0Q.text: Best Chinese food in North Carolina. From California and I can honestly say it better than anything I even had there.

2riANfrv2srtb1fAcp70pQ.text: Food was over cooked and far too salty. Service was rushed and very slow. Drive to Park Rd or Fort Mill for better service & much better food.

ICgi5gtTL_efHUSLXqu4vA.text: The best Chinese food I've had in Charlotte in the 12 years I've lived here. This place is desperately needed here as there is a lack of any authentic Chinese food

_Hhtit8EKOAV469aZNHWhQ.text: Awesome food! Love the lobster sticky rice. I've also tried the prawns and Chinese vegetables and it was also pretty good.

OHYYhjakurIUttwCanh1XA.text: Just moved to area & this Chinese restaurant a terrific surprise! Very fresh & authentic...we had Szechuan wonton app they make fresh w/melt in your mouth dough & delicious sauce :) then tried Beef  w/Lan peppers which really enjoyed. I don't care for spicy so I had prawns w/broccoli which waitress suggesting adding mixed veggies too & it was very fresh & flavorful. They take 1 day to make side chili sauce which my husband mixed w:his entree & loved. Highly recommend this hidden gem :)

oRXEDnkDc_KxrFSZ0djrFw.text: The restaurant was recommended as best one in Charlotte. We were very disappointed. The food is definitely way overpriced,and the taste is just so so. The food presentation is plain. The service is ok.

tzxRbnlZo3W19THRYstKCw.text: Took my crew here for lunch today. Everyone was blown away by the quality and the spice palette of the dishes. Servings were large, so we all could share, "family style". The menu was very broad, with lots of new things to experience. We will be back on a regular basis!

0wRzHbf4odS-_PByaS1Ecw.text: YUMMOOOO!!! I don't even wanna say much more because I had to order ToGo && KNOW I'LL BE BACK TO POST AN AMAZING REVIEW! I had pan fried dumplings & Singapore rice noodles w/ no chicken... WONDERFUL!!!

RBxRiYd0tmHQxMYcvnuMnA.text: If you want authentic Chinese food this is the place. There are plenty of American Chinese food places but this is a great option.The space is small so I recommend calling and picking up is you want to eat in the evening. It's fine during lunch.

3cDEjKMwslCjWjbY8luoLg.text: This is the best Chinese in the area. Hands down. Dumplings, special house fried rice, sesame beef and chicken all fantastic. We will definitely be back.

opait6ZF3ONdN9zFW1Mtig.text: First and only good - actually really good - Chinese we've had in Charlotte in 8 years. Pea tips, hot pot, mei/chow fun and all the Americanized stuff is excellent. Had out of sight beef with hot peppers - new to me. Headed back -25 mile drive tomorrow. Go try it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

y5sny4SDhx3V6mwrSwMedQ.text: I really was hoping this was a great Chinese Restaurant, I just could not get that out of this meal. We had ordered a lot of different typical Chinese dishes. The best item was our first which was the Chinese Dumplings or Pot Stickers, which were just steamed but filled with a very good pork and cabbage mixture. There was a few of us so we had a couple of different dishes. We had the Beef Chow Fun, with the big flat noodles, Not tasty and not good. We ordered the Beef and Broccoli, which had a lot more flavor that the Beef Chow fun but nothing out of the ordinary. We also had General Tso's Chicken which had some flavor but was fried way to crisp to chew. My favorite dish to try everywhere is the Singapore Rice Noodles, usually with a great Curry flavored sauce and chicken, shrimp and tofu. This came with some okay Chicken, Very dry noodles, no Curry taste at all. The shrimp were scarce and the tofu rubbery. I did not like it at all. I went because people have reviewed it and said it was great and authentic, I will give it another chance but this was not a good first impression.

AkC9ybqh6cBtk_Kgt4_irQ.text: Probably the most authentic Asian restaurant I've been too and it's so delish! I always get the curry noodle soup and the portions are nicely sized so I can have left overs for work the next day! It is totally worth the drive if you want something yummy!

KBI4RKpeUxbwjsPzjiDCBg.text: AMAZING!!!!! Best I have had in many many years. One dish is even better than the last. We have been going to a restaurant on  Mott St. In NY for many years, when we lived  in the area and when we go back. Lam's is at least as good maybe better. Five Stars sells it short. Enjoy!!!

m_-eTSQDYuq30eJ6J5P7fA.text: Great service. Beautiful and authentic preparation. Always busy - for a reason. You won't be disappointed.

ngGFSZDoX3aNKQ7Gx-thKA.text: Authentic Cantonese food finally!!!! If you go in wanting the usual Panda Express stuff you will be missing out (but I think they do those stuff pretty well too - I haven't tried any sesame chicken etc etc so I don't know) but the "real" dishes are top notch - the roast duck, bbq roast pork (I think this could be good entry-level dish if you haven't had authentic Chinese ever this is NOT normal western BBQ though)  if you had calamari somewhere else you have to try the salt and pepper squid (deep fried it's excellent) beef chow fun (beef with thick noodles cooked dry) is perfect with the char-taste from a hot wok and no ubiquitous brown sauce in sight. Great authentic dishes we love- pork belly with preserved vegetable, chicken-eggplant and salty fish clay pot (so good with white rice), pigs ear with chili sauce and the tripe with 5 spice - both comes chilled and excellent. I have been eyeing the fish and need to order a fish dish next time... they have a special list in Chinese - the waitresses will gladly translate - it usually contains fresh-seasonal vegetables, fresh seafood, and seasonal specialties like sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf....  it's such a treat to have them around!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

vVxogU0EWs4-EfCAXE1ZoQ.text: Nice staff good food. a local favorite. Went in here last friday and was taken care of immediately. Great service.

nrnDVAwm78qXn4oG0yU6Iw.text: Good to find this restaurant provides original and nice chinese food in south part of Charlotte!

aXLVcZ57mBfHRDvGgHEFVw.text: Don't let the paper and note menus fool you.  The food is delicious and authentic.  Szechuan cold appetizer and wontons are a great start...warning, mild is quite spicy.  Try off the special note menu- steam sea bass was cooked to perfection with ginger and scallion, fresh vegetables - baby gai lan and snow pea leaves all perfectly sauteed.   The hot pot of diced chicken, salty fish and either eggplant or tofu is plentiful of chicken and good bits of salty fish.     They just opened 2 months ago,  replacing a another favorite place.    It has taken us some time to find very good Chinese food since moving to Charlotte and this place is the real deal.   Small place and seats only ~ 24 people.     Small business and hope they succeed, definitely worth a try-  we will definitely be coming back!

WDOAC0uHhEdP_FLc0uoBGg.text: We hosted an international student from China for  few years and this was his favorite place to get authentic Chinese food. We went once. It definitely wasn't American Chinese, but it was good. If you are looking for a True taste of China, this is the place.

VkxyaKjkHAo1eMhbTJUTfA.text: It's nice to find a place the make authentic Chinese food. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was great! We started with the Szechuan wontons. A nice mix of pork and shrimp in a spicy sauce. For lunch we ordered the clay pot of seafood, salt and spice pork chop and the string beans with XO sauce.  Everything was delicious. Lots of leftovers. We will definitely be going back to eat our way through the menu. The best Chinese food I have had in the 12 years I've been living in NC.

4HQ04u6xEIan5L8g2wBuag.text: Nothing is more satisfying than finding an amazing place you'd want to bring your friends to! Hands down one of my favorite places for "food that hits the spot!" Talk about authentic Chinese comfort food. Found this hidden gem in Matthews, NC and it's our newest spot for delicious, fast, authentic Chinese food. My family of 6 dined in this compact sized restaurant on a late weekday evening and we were greeted and seated immediately. The menu and atmosphere is family friendly with high chairs available. Our food came out promptly and you can tell it was fresh out of the kitchen. Everything we ordered was beyond delicious! The portions are huge so we had lots of left overs for another family meal. Definitely on my hubby and my "A" list of places to eat around Charlotte! Go check them out and see for yourself. Here's what we ordered: 1. Crab Rangoon $5 for 6 2. Crispy Fried Shrimp Ball $8 for 4 (kids fave) 3. Beef brisket Noodle Soup $10 (hubby's fave) 4. Black Pepper Steak $16 (hubby's fave) 5. Chinese Style Fried Rice $12 (kids fave) 6. Salt and Spice Pork Chop $15 7. Eggplant in garlic sauce $12 8. Soft Shell Crab Hong Kong Style $16 (my fave) 9. Honey Roasted Pork $12  10. Steamed Lobster with Sticky Rice $45 (my fave)

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Soft shell crab - Hong Kong Style! Smells so divine!
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Eggplant in garlic sauce - the perfect consistency for the eggplant!
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Yah! You can see my kiddos enjoying their dinner!

rNaJj-6NAiBb3aZoo_Cbag.text: Hmm, I'm writing this a while after eating here but what remember is that the food was tasty...maybe too tasty salt wise. Serving size were good portions. Only major drawback is too lil seating. But, why is it that lil restaurants w/lil seating are always line intense w/customers waiting? Just like in Hawaii! But, in Hawaii, it means the food is super ono enuf for u to suffer the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Tiny n full of waiting customers

ROO4XPc7VgGvZv3eOzKYWQ.text: Excellent chinese food and delicious dishes! We tried the General Tao chicken entree and the steamed dumplings and crab rangoon appetizers. The dumplings were hot and savory with delicious sauces. The crab rangoon were crispy and tasty! I enjoyed the wonderful food. They don't have delivery so we had takeout. They were fast on a weeknight about 20 minutes. They are in a plaza near Harris Teeter off Potter rd.

34SzzZvvHjcLHI5lm5oq5A.text: Authentic Chinese food with great flavors. Will definitely try the entire menu. Small cozy space, not too many seats, but the food will liven your tastebuds. So why the dropped star. Value proposition is a bit lacking. They charge similar prices to Lee Cafe or Chuan Wang Fu, but you get half the portion size. If they work on giving you a bit more bang for your buck, I'd give them 5 stars. But with the limited seating, and smaller turn over ability, I can understand why they squeeze every dish, since they can only serve up so many each day.  Also, hard pass on their "lobster" dishes. You don't even get a full lobster tail for the price they charge you.  Give it a try, definitely a different offering than your other two Szechuan "Charlotte" offerings.

azokBIYbsPTSp25rGSAfjw.text: Hands down the best authentic Chinese food I've had anywhere in this area! The seafood pan fried noodles and salt and pepper pork chops were probably my favorite dish. I can't wait to try all the others. Only drawback of this place is it is a small restaurant, with only about 8 or 9 table's. It's not really close to any major roads either, but totally worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Salt &amp; Pepper pork chops!
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Oyster &amp; Tofu clay hotpot
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Beef Chow fun &amp; Snow pea tips in the background

cy29HRvfTELe9LJBQ9ZzBw.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. One good thing about this place is that they have good food. BUT! The problem is that they treated customers unfairly. One table arrived later than my table and this other couple's table. And that table got all of their food within maybe 10 minutes. While my table and the couple's table waited for 45+ minutes, our food still hadn't arrived. At least for my table, we finally got our food because we yelled at them to hurry up since we had already been waiting for a very long time. But the couple continued waiting, and while every table had food, they had nothing. Only their beverages. While eating my meal, my whole family and I were very upset because we felt it was so unfair to the couple that they still didn't have their food. They were patient enough to wait for an hour, but their food still didn't arrive. Not even one dish. So they left and their time was wasted. This is so unfair and nobody deserves to go through this. Even though this restaurant's food was very good, they don't know how to treat people with respect. This is disgusting and you shouldn't come to this restaurant.

DTtqcUCCGTAB-zzxByQxFQ.text: Very small restaurant, better served for take out. Food was delicious, very authentic, not too greasy. I would have given this restaurant 5 stars if their sanitation rating wasn't so low.  I didn't notice it until after we had ordered our food and were on our way out the door.  OMG, it's 90!  It takes a lot of serious violations for it to get down that low.  You may not think 90 sounds so bad, but do yourself a favor and look into it.  Sadly I won't order again because of this.  Not chancing it.

wljziNzMiDQLsJ2hKqEEfQ.text: Ordered from here on a tip from a neighbor.  Wow.  This is authentic, fresh, and phenomenal.  First, this isn't the Chinese food you're used to.  If you want heavily fried meats and thick sauces, there are lots of other food places.  This is authentic.  I would even suggest it for people who think they don't like Chinese food.  This is s step above.  I had the soft shell crab which came with greens and fresh chili peppers.  The crab was perfectly fried and obviously very fresh.  Portion was generous and price was a steal.  I also had the shrimp balls which were perfect.  Again, very fresh, big shrimp (unlike many other places).  Can't wait to explore other menu items!

rvyrJlroNbps_FqHUQwgTw.text: Amazing food and it all feels like it's home cooked. Never had any problems here and every employee are so nice. I usually get the snow peas tips and they are AMAZING! Seafood dishes are by far my favorite there and I love. Totally recommend this place to everyone.

rNEy4QOvIhmk_liwvKYjug.text: The best chinese in Charlotte.  More info to follow.  The crab dish was very tasty and the lobster curry was super.

EpqlxOZNJ-ruMhh0cdpdAA.text: omg! I have lived in Union County for over 11 years. I haven't had Chinese Food THIS GOOD since I've been in the area!!!  Fresh! Appealing to the eyes! Smelled wonderful! From the first bite to the last, I enjoyed EVERY MOMENT! I didn't want it to end! My taste buds have been BLESSED! I ate so much...the 'Itis is kicking in!   I only had the Malaysian Style Curry Chicken and the Shrimp Fried Rice. However, I will DEFINITELY be back for more and plan on trying all of my usual favorite Chinese dishes and some new ones!  ABSOFRIGGINLUTELY DELICIOUS

tqkVpYRiJKGCL6i6yGxhEA.text: Freshest and most authentic Asian restaurant I've ever been too.  Food was amazing.  This was our second visit so we wanted to try new dishes.  The shrimp balls were excellent as well as the steamed dumplings.   The chow fun was great as well as the Malaysian curry chicken.   Place is super small only 8 tables so be prepared to wait.

WWRC4ggHU9aaOUTfAaJlgA.text: I drove to this location to go to YUME Bistro for some ramen but was surprised it's now Lam's.  We gave it a try and were not disappointed. This place served very authentic Chinese dishes. I had fried shrimp balls for appetizer and stir fried squid. Both were delicious. My daughter had roasted duck noodle soup that she said was the best roasted duck she had in a long time.  The menu was in English and Chinese so definitely a good sign.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Duck noodle soup
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Chinese Menu

kerxy-b4Nz209oCb56PEOg.text: This is a legit Chinese food establishment. They offer an assortment of Chinese dishes that mainly targets a Chinese taste buds. Personally, their food is a bit too spicy for my liking, but I'm not going to deduct a star because I can't handle the heat.

vY_5VLvDUbkijZ538wVjLg.text: Finally authentic Chinese comes to Indian Trail. Staffed by friendly smiling faces who patiently indulged my curiosity I got a good feeling. I cannot say with any degree of practical knowledge if this fare is considered great/ good or poor, but on this night the place was filled with an ethnic group clearly familiar with the food and my palate was happy. The average American used to "Americanized Chinese" will not likely recognize many of the offerings but fear not and forage ahead, I don't think you'll be disappointed.  We took home Maylasian style chicken curry and Roasted Duck Noodle soup and both were delicious and not at all the oily and greasy concoctions so often offered by other shops.  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

Kjt1n9F2AOhTZyjnzhtuTw.text: Most authentic Chinese restaurant I have found in the area. You know you're in a good Chinese restaurant when you were the only white person there.  The hot and sour soup is my favorite and my kids can't get enough of the fried rice.

zebAUTiGwbleMii2R4JjFQ.text: Ordered curry chicken pepper steak hot and sour soup and crab Rangoon, probably the best Chinese food I had in a while , the people were very very friendly I'm not eating Chinese anywhere else again, I told my husband if Asian people eat here then this is a good place and I was right

Hg1madHtnAdVZOSs6eUccw.text: heard so much about this restaurant so my friends and I drove 2hrs to give it a try. Def. worth the drive. Love all the dishes especially the golden shrimp. Will def. come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

QUTosY0ojfGHIYCrv1uq5g.text: I absolutely love this place- food taste super authentic always fresh- cooked by order only and I can appreciate that. Because usually Asian spots already have food prepared and ready to go. Not this spot tho. I tried a new dish yesterday which was their shredded pork in garlic sauce OMG it was soooo good. My lunch date loved my dish so much she barely touched her beef and broccoli. Lol none the less her beef n broccoli was good too.   This place makes me think if I travelled to someplace in China or Japan this is how the food would taste. love it!

2X1rrYMnjkUax-fY-C04Ig.text: This is the best authentic Chinese food I have had in the United States.  This place is magic!  Recommendations: hot pots, steamed lobster, & vegetable special of the day.

O2EzF7fOkZerEzpj8KXQMA.text: All four dishes (crispy tofu, soft shell crab, eggplants clay pot, and seafood Mei Fun) that we ordered are all delicious! The tofu and soft shell crab are crispy and perfectly seasoned. The eggplants with salted fish is very nice and the wide noodles with seafood is cooked perfectly. It's surely nice to have another authentic Chinese restaurant in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

LptFUfpAakQlxEFU88aWrA.text: I met a friend here for lunch a few weeks ago and I was so disappointed.  The hostess/server was nice, but the food left all sorts of bad tastes in my mouth.   We ordered the Szechuan dumplings and they were supposed to be very spicy, but they had barely any heat. There was just a lot of oil on the plate which looked nice, but didn't really serve any purpose. The filling inside was very bland as well.   The Beef Shank was just as pretty and just as meh.  I ordered the Kung Pao chicken and it looked amazing. I started to eat it and I'm not sure how the chicken was prepared, but it had a sort of gooey coating around it and it was very chewy. I took two bites of it and couldn't bring myself to finish it. It was also very disappointing because I again expected heat and got none. The fried rice wasn't bad, though.  As I said, the service was fine, but it was definitely not worth the almost 45 minute drive. There are much better options available, in my opinion.

ST4gO43lk9mHzSWS6KYegg.text: Best authentic Chinese food in the greater Charlotte area. Extremely small. Cannot accommodate table of more than 4. Well worth the wait although I would try to come at an off time, either earlier or later than common popular times.

dWOrM1USRCiIBgttzpxArA.text: Delicious food! Dining room is very small so we took it to go. They do have seating outside but there were a lot of flies. The menu had something for everyone. Very fresh sauces and vegetables. Will definitely be going back!

lECGfRXvaqAeDQ4EuuPJvw.text: Omg the best authentic chinese food around hands down. A hidden gem of goodness. Service great. The food fantastic.  I'll be back

VDANuVpNQUDYvRQeZIcyMg.text: This is going to be semi complex to explain. But, if you're non Asian and/or simply used to American Chinese food? You may want to download the menu and Google each item and see what you like. This is an authentic Chinese restaurant for Chinese people. Don't expect super friendly jumpy staff because you wont get that. What you will get is good food. But, you must actually enjoy real Chinese food. Not the slop people eat in malls and call it Chinese food.

A8raUNUBrkTMlQhHHJQFqA.text: My Mom told me about this place and it is one of the BEST authentic Chinese food restaurants in Charlotte! We used to go to Tin Tin's, but after they changed their management, we stopped. There aren't many tables to sit at, but the service AND dishes are delicious! I can't wait to go back again. If you love Asian food, this is the place to go! And I grew up eating most of the dishes they serve, and I can promise it's the REAL DEAL!!!

-knc94F8HJupC1C4GE8M3g.text: Its the bomb. Have not been disappointed one time and its BYOB. Best Chinese food in the Charlotte Metro

Uwb-xx1ID2N5LlBaZQ1blA.text: A small hole in the wall restaurant. The food is really good and authentic. The dumplings are some of the best in town. The snow pea tips are good, We tried 5 o 6 different things and most of them were excellent with 2 exceptions. The lo mein was extremely bland. The pork fried had barely any pork in it and we would have liked some egg in it. Otherwise very well done food with good service.

xDnjjSxkIonTtbLqMkXC-Q.text: The best authentic Chinese restaurant in Charlotte hands down! The place is pretty small with only a couple of seatings but don't let that stop you from trying the food. I've been there multiple times trying different dishes and I haven't been disappointed. Curry, noodles, duck, clay pots are all good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

0Y3rKT0hEfAmIGQs_W1htw.text: I eat here quite often and the food is always good and never greasy. I always get my food to go so not sure how the sit in experience is. The only downfall to this restaurant is the fact that it takes forever to get your food. If you are making a to go order it is imperative that you call ahead and place your order because it may or may not be ready when you get there. I've been wanting to try the lobster for awhile now but every time that I go they never have it which sucks but hopefully one day they will have it and I will get the chance to try it. The food is ALWAYS delicious and you can tell that it is authentic. I would recommend this place to anyone!

XLET7ARFrAhEfGPvS2v3tA.text: Seriously delicious and tasty food ... we ordered the sesame chicken, orange chicken and kuangPao chicken with fried rice .. everything was super tasty and flavorful.. large portions.  The ladies in the kitchen are friendly. I wish they had more tables . Since they were super busy and had a long line outside . They also fill a lot of takeout orders ..  i hoe they stay this popular and expand .

Hh44yn-YD455HU0NgAzbGw.text: Authentic Chinese food with familiar dishes.   I tried the beef brisket clay pot that had 4 chilies . Husband is Korean, so heat is not a factor. I do not recommend this dish. Flavor was a little bit odd. What I taste it was ginger, spicy and bitter flavor but the meat  was very bland and needed salt.  The beef chow fun was good. Nice thick noodles with tender beef and bean sprouts. I will try the seafood chow fun next time.   The stir-fry green beans came with minced pork.  very flavorful. Definitely recommend it for vegetable dish.   The best dish was the salty and spicy prawns. This is the best one we've had in Charlotte area. The prawns come with the heads and you eat everything. It was nice and crispy and flavor was spot on. Same as salt and pepper shrimps. Whole shrimps crispy fried and then sauteed with garlic, salt, and black peppers.  I recommend coming here. I do not recommend trying the clay pot dishes unless you are used to the flavors. Worth the drive.

w0aLB_FGf6c4d31OLVQa7w.text: This is the only authentic Chinese restaurant I have found in Charlotte area after two months of moving here. Generally they have both authentic Chinese and American Chinese (e.g. Orange chicken) on their menu. It is up to you which you would like to have. HowevIt is surprising that a Cantonese restaurant can cook Szechwan food so well. But of course, their Cantonese cuisine is also great.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

T-VhCyE6u8Zx_Reyx-TKEw.text: This is the most authentic Chinese place in Charlotte and it's great!! I am Chinese and have lived in Toronto, Hong Kong, and New York. I was shocked this place rivals the very good restaurants in those places (and I never really liked the Chinese food in NY). Every dish I have had there so far has been excellent. Lobster, salt and pepper squid, snow pea tips, chow mein, baby bok choy are all top notch. Very friendly service. I went at odd hours so waiting was not an issue. Looking forward to going again!

1FYfoaTio267RDM8mIjnUA.text: Food poisoning  Ordered beef pepper steak to go.  The meat looked really dark but we thought it was maybe the way it was cooked.  We ate it.  A few hours later, vomiting, upset stomach and in the bathroom.  Got so sick.  Called Doctor.  Please stay away from this place.

JKpoPc3FaxsQ-1FTJZNWcw.text: The most authentic Chinese food I have had in North Carolina.   The spicy Szechuan dumplings were so fresh and so good I devoured them before I could take a photo.  Here's the other perfect menu items i tried:  The ma-po tofu was classic with little bits of pork,  The Yu-Xiang pork was fresh, slightly sweet and slightly vinegary.  The fresh pea shoots were green and tender.  They even had nice outside seating that worked great of a warm mosh spring day.  The staff are friendly and helpful. What a joy!

8-_E4dlfZ5DZqyffk_RqXQ.text: This place is legit, loved the food and the sweetness of the ladies working there. I got General tso chicken, it was the best I've tasted. Very authentic, when the menu shows a pepper they mean it, hmmmmm so worth the drive!!!! Not your typical Chinese restaurant, very much above our ran down places with food loaded with sugar. That we are used to.

Uz4wE26CVekydtxQUXfkyQ.text: Lam's Kitchen, hidden in Matthews, serves up fresh authentic Chinese food. Walk in & look immediately to your left & see the flames burning and wok's cooking something delicious. This dish is the Hong Kong style lobster  full of crispiness & flavors , it's a must have if you enjoy lobster!  There are long wait times during peak hours & sometimes they do sell out of certain dishes. Give a call ahead of time!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

De_N_FDjMoD_Ma26RPi6eg.text: The first thing I noticed upon entering was the heat from the hot wok directly to my left. I was thankful it was unseasonably cool that day otherwise I think it might have been too hot to eat inside. Next, I noticed that it was a lot smaller inside than I was expecting. I counted 26 seats. I was also reassured by the fact that it appeared as though we were the only non-Asians in the house. That's always a good sign if you are eating that particular cuisine.  On to the food and drinks (or lack thereof). That's right, no beer. Would it kill them to have a cooler of Tsingtao? Oh well, the water was good. We ordered crab rangoon. Yum! Nicely fried shell around delicious cream cheesy crabby goodness.  For the entrees we shared the eggplant with vegetables and the general tso's chicken. Both were unique and flavorful and we both had enough to take home for lunch the next day. I can't wait to try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

Fyw2IN8TKFlkBPT_Otf0DA.text: Authenticity... There is no other way to describe this place than pure authenticity. If you are looking for traditional, family style Chinese food, then look no further. I wish there were more places like this around Charlotte. If you haven't had traditional Chinese food (none of that Sesame Chicken sh*t), then this place will rock your world. You will not be disappointed!  Tips - Come early because there aren't many tables/seats - Go with a group of 4+ and each order a unique dish to share - Try something new: get outside your comfort zone  Recommendations - Boiled Chilean Seabass Szechuan style - Black Pepper Steak - Braised Pork Belly  - Salted Fish, Diced Chicken with Tofu Claypot Dish

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Black Pepper Steak
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Braised Pork Belly
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Menu

bGdJAgFNyq7gKoYZCbh3dA.text: - pretty authentic szechuan and cantonese dishes - also some classic chinese american dishes you probably shouldn't order - very large portions (1 app + 3 main dishes was too much for 3 people; I'd recommend 1 dish per person) - ask for sides of rice (no extra charge) - order the vegetables that are in season  - come early on weekends, the place is small - indoor and outdoor seating - spicy is not really that spicy (and I can't handle spice) - food comes out quickly - dishes are really oily (but this is normal when eating at restaurants) - service is not particularly friendly but also not rude - give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Chicken appetizer
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Kung pao chicken
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Seasonal veggies

4VvH9uUVtHE2zv7rU8L4sQ.text: If you want the best authentic Chinese food in the Charlotte area come to Lam's Kitchen (or my house). Their staff is always friendly and their dishes are freshly made unlike most Chinese restaurants. Since the restaurant itself is pretty small you can see into the kitchen and can clearly tell they cook your food fresh right after you order. It's what makes their food super fresh, flavorful and authentic.   I've been here many times and I would say my favorite dishes are the Sweet and Sour Pork + any of their Claypot dishes (especially with eggplant). They also don't charge extra for rice or refills on the rice unlike most Chinese restaurants. Their prices are also reasonable to their portions.   Honestly, I don't think there is a better restaurant in the Charlotte area that has more delicious and truly authentic Chinese cuisine. The restaurant is very small and has limited seating so make sure to account for that if you are planning to eat here on busy nights. With the sheer authenticity and freshness of their food, I honestly thought the restaurant would be more popular by now. But at the same time, I'm selfish and love that I can always come here on a Friday night and taste an authentic home cooked Chinese meal without too much of a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Spinach with triEggs in Broth
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Menu 2
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Menu

MNBRDmjja1Jhjq_b-oC8iA.text: This is a small and cozy place.  The food is different and delicious.  It was tasteful  and with rich flavors.  Although the staff is very helpful and willing to help their service still needs improvement.  But I will still come back just because of the food.  Update:  I visited this place again two weeks ago.  Food is really good.  We had some of the more common dishes (i.e sweet and sour pork) and even those dishes taste fresh and different.  Keep the good work and q

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Malaysian Curry Chicken

nubpuFJKbwdPgCdka97-uQ.text: Authentic, delicious, best Chinese restaurant in Charlotte area.Some famous Sichuan dishes, lots of traditional Cantonese dishes, LOVE!

pVuvmEQQl4GlUPHJa62CoQ.text: Hands down, the best Chinese food I've had. We arrived shortly after they opened (11:30 on a Thursday). Our waitress took our orders right away and promptly brought out our drinks. The smell of the garlic and spices wafting in from the kitchen really got my excited for what I was about to eat. We ordered the mapo tofu and the chow fun with mushrooms. Not only was the chow fun perfectly cooked and delicious, but the mapo tofu rivaled what I had when I visited Japan. It's a bit pricey, but the portions are generous, and it served family style (large bowls with big spoons that you can use to portion what you want onto your individual plate). I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area. Soooo goooood!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Chow fun with mushrooms.
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Mapo tofu with minced pork

KCgkHKacShsKXvaVbSJwdg.text: Excellent authentic Chinese food. The menu has a fantastic selection and the service is good. We tried it for the first time this past week and we will definitely go back.

us_7qHG_Nq71jST5yC3aJg.text: Talk about your hole in the wall. Right down from the Asia market it this delicious place. I've never had such authentic Chinese cuisine I will never eat anywhere else unless I actually go to China. Now it is small and located next to the Harris teeter but I would also recommend calling ahead and picking up since they do take a bit to make the food right. We had the sticky rice lobster which was great, the Szechuan dumplings, egg rolls and don't even get me started on the general tsos chicken. The chicken was cooked perfect very tender and moist. Wow. We will be back I am so impressed. Another thing we found interesting is that the menu offered jellyfish. May try this.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Sticky rice lobster

qqUu-RoT7iO3F8tLSwT7CA.text: Reviewing this restaurant as a Chinese girl who loves traditional Cantonese cuisine - I've got high expectations ;) Honestly, the negative reviews come from people who aren't ordering the truly Chinese dishes or who don't know how to appreciate them - ignore those reviews!   Lam's Kitchen is literally one of the two-three Chinese restaurants in Charlotte that serve legitimate Chinese cuisine. My family frequents this place just about once a week and are always here for family dinners! Sadly, our Asian cuisine is very lacking in this city still! Some of my favorite dishes include their mushroom hotpot, lobster with vermicelli, beef ho-fun, and any fresh veggies they've got that day. Lam's does not take reservations and can get very busy on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Lobster with Vermicelli (special menu only - changes weekly)
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Veggie (changes daily depending on what&#39;s fresh)

XL8BcdFlYnubCXTgF_c6Aw.text: 4.5 stars  If you're looking for traditional Cantonese food (Hong Kong style) this is your go-to spot. Their food rivals what you'd find in Chinatowns in NY and Boston.   The restaurant itself is small with only one large table so not a good place for groups. There are also only 2 cooks so when it's busy the wait for food (either for dine-in or take out) can be long.  We like the beef chow fun and salt and pepper squid here. You can get roast pork and duck here too!

_aPIVqjNdRPvg9mUyHbJQg.text: Great service, friendly staff and super yummy food!!! Best fried dumplings I've had in a long time, flavorful sauces and perfectly cooked chicken and broccoli! We'll be back for sure!

USU4bsuryr03VBZlQTicKA.text: The deception was real!  I can appreciate beautifully plated food because we do, after all, eat with our eyes 1st right? But then, when the time comes to insert food in mouth, the chow best be delicious! I drove 40 minutes to give this restaurant a try. Do I think it was worth it? Unfortunately, not.  The chow:  Szechuan Dumplings- zero flavor, zero heat, zero numbness. Szechuan is know for their extremely spicy peppers and numbing peppercorns. I guess they weren't invited to the party. The shrimp and chicken inside these dumplings were not seasoned. The oil was red, but not spicy. I had to drown my dumplings in soy sauce to experience some sort of flavor.  Beef Shank App-covered in the same oil as the Szechuan dumplings, same topping, same disappointment.  Kung Poa Chicken-my friend ordered this dish, took one bite, and didn't touch it again. The so-called chicken was minced small like the peanuts,  had this weird soft coating around it, had an awkward chewiness, and tasted nothing like chicken. The fear factor went up a notch.  Flat Noodle Dish w/ Shrimp-decent wok flavor. This saved the meal for me.  If you want to try more authentic Szechuan food, check out Chuan Wang Fu and ask for the "other menu." You'll then discover why Lam's is not winning with me. Peace.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Beef Shank app
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Szechuan dumplings. Run.

aHkxXyGdLT1diayc7zNnBQ.text: What a GREAT find! We need more places like these around the city, my only wish is that this place was bigger! It'd be nice if the space was bigger so you can bring more people and order more food, you know what I mean?  We ordered a conglomeration of foods ranging from the Lobster in Sticky Rice (special) to Salted Fish in the clay pot. The food was not excessively salty like many other Chinese places. The sticky rice was phenomenal, full of fish eggs mixed within the rice. We also ordered Chow Fun, Hong Kong style lobster and crab, string beans, and fried rice. They do put a lot of green onion and pepper on the lobster and crab and the portion of seafood can be small for a big party, however it's worth getting! The batter could use a little more seasoning.   The staff was SO kind, there may have been a slight language barrier, but they will take the time to understand you and accommodate.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Crab HK Style
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Lobster HK Style
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States. Lobster Sticky Rice

zrvkq5V6dnSn7NuGWnaXGg.text: While it has been a while since I have been in this building, I didn't think it had been that long, but apparently long enough for the tenant to swap out - the last time here it was a different restaurant entirely!  And more importantly, the string of tasty eats in this strip mall continues, so even if you do not like Chinese, check it out because there are plenty of options here.  At any rate - due to the Chinese New Year, we thought we would go for some authentic food, and luckily we arrived just before the rush, since there are not many places to sit in this small spot. We were literally the last two seats in the place - and there were plenty who showed up after us that decided it just wasn't worth waiting. Now I am not saying the food isn't, just that the small space was too crowded.  As to the food, it can be a bit hit or miss. But the service is spot on. And you won't get anything like this at Manchu Wok. As with most items, there are some that are better than others, so you might have to search the menu a little, but it's definitely worthwhile to try and find something to your liking. We were actually eyeing the lobster next to us on our way out. I think we'll have to try that one soon...

bxJfKgmdHQZs9I4q1q68wQ.text: I have been trying to find a good authentic Chinese restaurant in Charlotte for awhile now. I think I found the one! Lam's Kitchen is delicious. The food is very fresh and has a lot of flavor. I would highly recommend this place for families. Everything is definitely meant to be shared. My family had a great time and we enjoyed all the good food. Thanks to the amazing staff that helped served us. They were super friendly and accommodating!

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States

o6Zbe0NlBKwkuOvTXgB0hw.text: Sure, there's a couple "American" dishes on the menu--after all, Lam's Kitchen understands hospitality--so everyone feels welcome. But--if it is authentic Chinese Food you are after--this is the place. High quality, good portions, good service. This is the real deal. Worth the drive. Worth the wait to be seated if necessary. Great spot. Try it.

S1cENpB4L35cl9YPIjrILQ.text: Not bad, but not my favorite, and a bit in the pricey side. As an example, most places ask you what kind of rice you want with your entree and will substitute fried for white, but At Lam's you only get white rice. If you want fried rice, you have to order a separate portion of fried rice, which isn't cheap.

NDt25bIiTI6gZsWWRB3yuA.text: This place came highly recommended to all of us so we thought we'd give it a try. The place is far out in Indian Trail. The place is very small with maybe about 20 seats inside and 3-4 tables outside. Although, it was too cold for outside dining. Took about 40 minutes to get a label for us 7. We had a little of everything. Cold chicken was ok but definitely better with the ginger sauce but you'd have to ask for it. The lobster was delicious but some pieces were hard to crack open. Seemed like too much work. The fried rice was good. Very aromatic. Our least favorite was the jelly fish. It was just different from what we've had. It's a unique texture and flavor. The intestines were different and not as crispy as we had hoped for. The best dish was the salt and pepper prawns (head on). They were perfectly seasoned and fried to a nice crisp. I would definitely go back for the prawns. The service was good. They were friendly and accommodating. BYOB.

photos.caption: Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Lam's Kitchen - Matthews, NC, United States
